In the initial stages of the fashion for jiuta, there were many pieces with melodies which strongly resembled those of jiuta for the samisen.
At the initial stage of merging with jiuta, there were many pieces with melodies that were almost the same as those for the shamisen part in jiuta.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: また、器楽部分では掛け合いと呼ばれる類似の旋律を三弦と交互に演奏するような作曲もみられる。
sen.e: Also, there is a composition called kakeai that plays similar melody by shamisen and koto alternately at a part of instrumental music
There were also compositions with parts (called "kakeai") which are interchangeable between the koto and samisen.
There were also compositions with parts (called "kakeai") which are interchangeable between the koto and shamisen.

sen.j: その後、一般的に替手（かえで）と呼ばれる、地歌の三弦の旋律を引き立て、装飾するような複雑な旋律の作曲が多くなってゆく。
sen.e: After that, the composition became more decorative and complicated melody which brought out the melody of shamisen of jika which is called kaede generally.
Later, more compositions appeared with sophisticated melodies provided to make the melody of the samisen stand out within the jiuta.
Later, more compositions called "kaede" appeared with sophisticated melodies provided to make the melody of the shamisen stand out within the jiuta.
sen.cmt: shamisen としました。替手 を追加しました。

sen.j: さらに、地歌から独立した作曲が多くなってゆくと、箏独特の奏法を駆使した旋律による曲が作曲されるようになっていった。
sen.e: Then, the composition that separated from jika increased, the melody with good command of performance of unique koto music was composed.
Then, as more compositions independent of jiuta appeared, music with melodies driven by the unique sound of the koto came to be written.
Then, as more music pieces composed independent of jiuta appeared, music came to be written that has melodies making full use of the unique technique of koto playing method.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: ただし、これらは箏曲として作曲された曲に限る。
sen.e: But these are only music that plays for sokyoku.
Note that the only compositions of this type are those specifically composed as sokyoku.
sen.cmt: Isn't this a statement of the obvious?
sen.e: Note that the only compositions of this type are those specifically composed as sokyoku.

sen.j: この他にも、箏は地歌の曲のほとんどすべてと合奏可能である。
sen.e: Except that, koto is able to ensemble with almost all jiuta music.
The koto is also able join the ensemble in nearly all jiuta music.
